author: Taylor Liberti
title: Boys and Girls Club targets crucial 6th grade year with free after-school program in Greece - WHEC.com
text:
GREECE, N.Y. – The Boys and Girls Club is expanding its programming to Greece, hoping to give 6th graders a new option for how they spend their time after school. The after-school program is open to any 6th grader at Greece Arcadia, free of charge. It’s funded with a five-year grant from the Boys and Girls Club and has been a bit of a passion project for the school’s principal.
At first, McKeegan Coyne wasn’t sure he’d be into it.
“I was like a little nervous cause I’ve never done one of these before, I never stayed after school,” Coyne tells News10NBC.
Coyne is a 6th grader at Arcadia and quickly got over his nerves. He now chooses to stay almost until closing time every night.
“It’s introduced me and to new people…I think it’s really cool cause I can connect with more people, and more people can connect with me,” he says
His mom, Jamie Coyne, loves it.
“The social aspect of it is amazing. He’s hanging out with kids that he might not normally hang out with during the day which I think is great for him, he’s like, ‘Yeah I made a new friend today,’ which is great,” she says.
The 6th graders start with homework and reading every day after school but after that, there’s gaming, sports, arts and crafts, relays, and then dinner.
“We get a lot of parents who work until 5 o’clock and they don’t want their student to be home alone until that time and I don’t blame them,” says Cassidy Osborne, the program director.
Sixth grade is often a crucial year in a child’s development. They’ve just moved up from elementary school, they’re learning a lot about themselves and who they want to be and it’s crucial to have support and positive role models.
“I think that if we give them a safe place that they can come and just hang out with their peers and they can get that physical activity and they can get all the things that they need instead of going out and hanging out in the streets or at random stores or anything like that if we’re giving them that space then that’s my main goal,” Osborne says.
The program runs from 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. every weeknight and the activities change daily.
“We listen to the kids and whatever they want to do as long as it’s reasonable and we can make it happen, I’m going to make it happen,” Osborne says.
It’s already led to some grateful students and parents.
“He’s a kid I never thought would do clubs, he’s like, ‘No I gotta get home, I gotta hang out with my friends, I gotta be on electronics.’ He’s now stayed after school every single day this week and he’s doing e-sports twice a week, this has been the most amazing transition for him and it’s been great,” Jamie Coyne says.
There’s still room in the program for other 6th graders at Greece Arcadia. Eventually, the district and the Boys and Girls Club are hoping to expand the program to other middle schools and beyond 6 th grade.
*A.I. assisted with the formatting of this story. Click here to see how WHEC News 10 uses A.I.*

author: Brainy Insights Pvt. Ltd.
title: Biocomposites Market to Grow at CAGR of 16.92% through
text: Newark, April 11, 2024 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- The Brainy Insights estimates that the USD 31.41 billion in 2023 global biocomposites market will reach USD 149.95 billion by 2033. The idea of a circular economy, which highlights resource efficiency, waste reduction, and material recycling, presents significant opportunities for biocomposites. Manufacturers are exploring closed-loop systems for biocomposite production, recycling, and reuse, thereby minimizing waste and maximizing resource utilization throughout the product lifecycle. Furthermore, the development of bio-based additives and fillers derived from renewable resources will further enhance the sustainability profile of biocomposites. These additives can improve material properties, enhance processing characteristics, and reduce costs while reducing reliance on petroleum-based additives. Download PDF Brochure: https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=RfKfTTnMf8nzLz_58a8FBDvpiq2_f3NmU4sGXGDTvl_wDsnSbYsuCz-SpP7x0WOHpM7vbNO2ZWw3gkSFmu5I9AOkwyqesAOum9ifKCtGzIWcyFBRYaK2ROb7r_RsqGdwQuUhUKDMPX1HeMl_C6TebavrbEVUy8fV2kL2DOqCwjiJtpGRXUTpQiLuGkMJt2Inj9IoagNiIyTxoCW3y0QQ0g== Additionally, integrating smart technologies and functional additives into biocomposites will enable the development of advanced materials with enhanced functionality and performance. Smart biocomposites with sensing, self-healing, and antimicrobial properties will find applications in the automotive, aerospace, healthcare, and consumer electronics sectors. Besides, collaborative partnerships between industry players, research institutions, and government agencies will accelerate innovation and market development in the biocomposites sector. Investments in research, infrastructure, and commercialization initiatives will further drive the growth and adoption of biocomposite technologies globally. In addition, emerging industries such as renewable energy, healthcare, and 3D printing present new opportunities for biocomposites. Biocomposite materials can be used in wind turbine blades, medical implants, drug delivery systems, and customized consumer products, leveraging their unique properties and sustainability benefits. Report coverage & details: |Report Coverage||Details| |Forecast Period||2024–2033| |Base Year||2023| |Market Size in 2023||$ 31.41 billion| |Market Size in 2033||$ 149.95 billion| |CAGR||16.92%| |No. of Pages in Report||185| |Segments Covered||by Fiber Type, Polymer Type, Product, End-Use Industries| |Drivers||Advancements in Technology| |Opportunities||Expanding Application Areas| |Restraints||Limited Material Availability| Key Insight of the global Biocomposites market Asia Pacific is expected to witness the highest market growth over the forecast period. The vehicle and construction sectors are major buyers of biocomposites in the Asia Pacific, driven by trends such as lightweight, fuel efficiency, and green building practices. Biocomposites offer lightweight, durable, and eco-friendly alternatives to traditional materials like steel, plastics, and concrete, making them increasingly attractive for vehicle components, building materials, and infrastructure projects. Additionally, Asia Pacific is witnessing significant advancements in biocomposite technology, driven by research and development efforts, academic institutions, and collaborations between industry players. These advancements lead to improvements in material properties, processing techniques, and application versatility, enhancing the competitiveness of biocomposites in the market. Most importantly, there is growing awareness and concern about environmental sustainability and climate change in Asia Pacific. Consumers, businesses, and governments increasingly favour eco-friendly products and practices, driving demand for biocomposites as a greener alternative to conventional materials. Asia Pacific countries invest heavily in infrastructure development, including transportation networks, renewable energy projects, and sustainable urban development initiatives. Biocomposites offer opportunities for innovation and sustainability in these projects, driving market growth in the region. Furthermore, emerging markets in the Asia Pacific, such as India, Indonesia, Vietnam, and Thailand, are experiencing rising disposable incomes and increasing consumer spending on sustainable products. This growing consumer base presents significant opportunities for the region's manufacturers and suppliers of biocomposites. In 2023, the wooden fiber composites segment held the largest market share at 68.53% and a revenue of 21.53 billion. The fiber type segment is split into wooden fiber composites and non-wood fiber composites. In 2023, the wooden fiber composites segment held the largest market share at 68.53% and a revenue of 21.53 billion. In 2023, the natural polymer segment dominated the market with the largest share of 62.47% and revenue of 19.62 billion. The polymer type segment is divided into natural polymer and synthetic polymer. In 2023, the natural polymer segment dominated the market with the largest share of 62.47% and revenue of 19.62 billion. In 2023, the green biocomposites segment dominated the market with the largest share of 65.18% and revenue of 20.47 billion. The product segment includes hybrid biocomposites and green biocomposites. In 2023, the green biocomposites segment dominated the market with the largest share of 65.18% and revenue of 20.47 billion. In 2023, the transportation segment dominated the market with the largest share of 36.29% and revenue of 11.40 billion. The end-use industries segment is classified into building & construction, consumer goods, transportation and others. In 2023, the transportation segment dominated the market with the largest share of 36.29% and revenue of 11.40 billion. Procure Complete Report (185 Pages PDF with Insights, Charts, Tables, and Figures): https://www.globenewswire.com/Tracker?data=RfKfTTnMf8nzLz_58a8FBDvpiq2_f3NmU4sGXGDTvl8jKrQnSHP6JKPs_-0YjSgXiWt0YDrXaRIIcHkJUucCc6MUfYqCwyWj9LsJoKQvSiFE7aUDbbJNwhmtff1YJeHUISMemggbrO4g33Zx-ABuNkErm6Khv4juLuNyn73pIrvd-cDu7GwxjqTjtMV64KrnwYNshNmrkAAY1TXJ9acrPw== Advancement in market In September 2022: Fiberon introduces the debut of Wildwood composite cladding, delivering the unparalleled charm and warmth reminiscent of wood, coupled with the longevity of high-performance, low-maintenance materials. With an open-joint profile, Wildwood composite cladding offers versatility in design, available in a range of board lengths and widths to enhance creative flexibility. Market Dynamics Driver: Growing demand in the automotive sector. The automotive industry is shifting significantly towards adopting biocomposites, primarily motivated by the imperative to lessen vehicle weight and enhance fuel efficiency while maintaining safety and performance standards. Biocomposites, composed of natural fibers and resins, present a compelling alternative to conventional materials like steel and plastics due to their lightweight nature and durable characteristics. This growing interest in biocomposites is largely driven by the urgent requirement to manage environmental concerns and comply with stringent emissions and fuel consumption regulations. Manufacturers can achieve substantial weight reductions without compromising structural integrity or safety by integrating biocomposite materials into various automotive components such as interior panels, door panels, and dashboards. Moreover, biocomposites offer additional advantages beyond weight reduction, including enhanced sustainability and a lower carbon footprint than traditional materials. These factors align well with the automotive industry's broader sustainability goals and initiatives to reduce environmental impact throughout the vehicle's lifecycle. As research and development efforts advance, biocomposites are expected to play an increasingly prominent role in the automotive sector, driving innovation in material science and manufacturing processes. This trend reflects a broader industry-wide shift towards more sustainable and eco-friendly practices, positioning biocomposites as a key technology for shaping the future of automotive design and production. Restraint: Standardization and certification restraints. The absence of standardized testing methods and certification processes for biocomposite materials can introduce uncertainty regarding their performance and applicability for specific uses. This uncertainty is a significant barrier to adoption, especially in sectors with rigorous quality and safety standards. In industries where precise material properties are crucial, such as aerospace, automotive, and construction, the lack of standardized biocomposite testing protocols can deter manufacturers from integrating these materials into their products. Without established benchmarks and certification procedures, it becomes challenging for companies to assess biocomposite components' reliability, durability, and safety. This uncertainty often leads to hesitation among decision-makers, who may opt for conventional materials with well-defined testing standards and certification processes to mitigate risk. Additionally, regulatory compliance requirements further compound the issue, as industries with stringent safety regulations demand thorough documentation and validation of materials used in their products. Opportunity: Market penetration in developing regions. Asia, Africa, and Latin American markets are poised to become significant growth opportunities for biocomposites, spurred by rapid industrialization, urbanization, and escalating consumer demand. These regions present expansive markets for sustainable materials buoyed by governmental initiatives, heightened environmental consciousness, and evolving consumer tastes. Countries like China and India are witnessing unprecedented economic development and urban expansion in Asia, driving a surge in infrastructure projects and consumer goods consumption. With growing concerns over environmental degradation and resource depletion, there is a mounting push towards adopting eco-friendly materials like biocomposites. Government policies promoting sustainability and increasing public awareness about environmental issues further catalyze the demand for these alternatives. Similarly, countries such as Brazil, Mexico, and Colombia are experiencing rapid urbanization and industrial growth in Latin America. As these nations grapple with environmental challenges like deforestation and pollution, there is a growing recognition of the importance of sustainable development. Consequently, there is a rising demand for biocomposites as viable solutions to mitigate environmental impact while meeting infrastructure and consumer needs. In Africa, burgeoning economies like Nigeria, South Africa, and Kenya are witnessing a burgeoning middle class and expanding urban populations. As these nations strive for economic progress, there is a growing priority on sustainable approaches and green technologies. Government initiatives promoting renewable resources and reducing carbon emissions provide a conducive environment for adopting biocomposites in various sectors, including construction, automotive, and consumer goods. Overall, the convergence of rapid industrialization, urbanization, and shifting consumer preferences in these emerging markets creates fertile ground for the growth of the biocomposites industry. By leveraging these opportunities and addressing specific regional challenges, biocomposite manufacturers can establish a strong foothold in these dynamic and rapidly evolving markets. Challenge: Market education and awareness. The need for more awareness and understanding among consumers, designers, engineers, and manufacturers regarding biocomposite materials' benefits, capabilities, and applications can pose a significant challenge to their widespread adoption. For consumers, there may be limited knowledge about the existence and potential of biocomposite materials, leading to a preference for traditional materials without considering the sustainability and performance advantages of biocomposites. Designers and engineers may also need more familiarity with biocomposite materials' design possibilities and structural capabilities. Furthermore, manufacturers may need help integrating biocomposites into their production processes due to a lack of knowledge about sourcing, processing, and handling these materials. Overall, proactive efforts to educate consumers, designers, engineers, and manufacturers about the benefits and applications of biocomposite materials are essential for overcoming barriers to adoption and fostering market growth. author: Clínica Cruz Jiminián estrena equipo para Endoscopía y Hepatología con IA
title: Clínica Cruz Jiminián estrena equipo para Endoscopía y Hepatología - Diario Libre
text:
La Clínica Cruz Jiminián inauguró este jueves la Unidad de Endoscopia y Hepatología ( Hepagastro ), que contará con equipos de alta tecnología que permitirán una evaluación y detección de lesiones en etapa precoz.
El equipo de endoscopia , modelo Eluxeo Lite, de Fujifilm, permite mediante el uso de tecnología LCI y BLI obtener imágenes de alta definición, para una mejor evaluación y caracterización de las lesiones del tracto digestivo.
También contará con el equipo Fibroscan Compact 530, de Echosens, el cual permite evaluar de forma rápida, no invasiva y segura, la cantidad de grasa y el grado de fibrosis hepática en etapas tempranas antes de que evolucione a cirrosis o cáncer de hígado .
"Este equipo que se inicia hoy es un equipo muy diferente, en el país, tal vez haya tres o cuatro, pero no más moderno que este porque esta es la última tecnología ", declaró Félix Antonio Cruz Jiminián, director del centro médico.
El galeno explicó que, "con este equipo se va a hacer una endoscopía con inteligencia artificial , eso significa que cualquier lesioncita, por mínima que sea, se puede detectar si se va a convertir en maligna en un año o dos años".
https://resources.diariolibre.com/images/2024/04/04/whatsapp-image-2024-04-04-at-12.14.21-pm.jpeg
Los equipos son de última tecnología. ( NEAL CRUZ ) Los aparatos permiten obtener imágenes comparables a una biopsia sin los métodos invasivos .
Asimismo, garantizó que "ningún paciente pobre puede dejar de atenderse por falta de dinero y eso lo vamos a mantener mientras vida tenga, por eso vamos a trabajar con Senasa subsidiado".
La moderna unidad Hepagastro estará a cargo de los gastroenterólogos Johanel Wanderlinder y Walfan Marte Comprés.
RELACIONADAS

author: 蕃新聞
title: 台中環保局馳援嘉義縣災後復原　民眾感佩援助同心走過災後時刻
text:
台中環保局馳援嘉義縣災後復原 民眾感佩援助同心走過災後時刻
民生電子報/
1 小時前
記者馬源培／台中報導
台中市政府環保局「台中隊」昨(9)日持續挺進嘉義縣災區協助丹娜絲颱風災後復原工作，連續2日的支援行動，台中隊員們除完成道路清理與倒樹障礙排除任務外，更深刻感受到當地民眾滿滿的溫情與支持。
環保局清潔同仁昨日在朴子市執行救援任務時，因近日連日降雨造成地面鬆軟，一部抓斗車不慎陷入泥沼，動彈不得。當下朴子市竹南里的里長得知情況後，立即親自駕駛鐵牛(耕耘機)趕至現場，以拖拉方式成功協助抓斗車脫困重返作業線。當地民眾也紛紛遞送茶水慰勞、鼓掌致意，甚至不吝比出大拇指為台中隊加油打氣，直說：「嘉義人就是自己人！」
環保局也說，許多嘉義在地民眾看到台中隊揮汗工作，紛紛自動加入清理行列，拿起掃把、協助搬運枝幹，與台中隊並肩作戰，攜手為家園復原努力。這份跨縣市間的互助情誼，真切展現「同島一命、同舟共濟」的精神，也讓所有救災人員深受感動，士氣大振。
環保局分享，此次支援行動也讓台中隊成員有親身體會「無網路世界」的經驗，災區已進入停電第四天，許多區域基地台受損，只能利用短暫經過尚有供電的地點，搶到一點訊號回覆工作訊息後，繼續救災工作。
環保局表示，無論是地面作業的艱辛、通訊受阻的不便，或是來自民眾的溫暖與回應，都將成為此次災後支援最真實的印記；台中隊也將配合嘉義縣需求，持續投入人力與機具，陪伴受災地區一同走過復原之路。
此篇文章最開始出處為:

author: Bre Avery Zacharski
title: Her Boyfriend Routinely Puts Her In Time-Out And She Feels Like He Acts More Like A Dad To Her Than Anything Else
text:
Time-out is a well-known parenting technique that is used to deal with an unruly child exhibiting poor behavior.
It’s pretty simple: you take the child out of the situation where they’re not behaving and give them space to regain composure and reflect on what they did wrong.
While I’ve heard of this being widely used on children, I can’t say I’ve ever heard about an adult trying to use this on another adult before. Well, that is, until now.
This 24-year-old girl has a boyfriend the same age as her, and he routinely puts her in “time-out” in an effort to punish her for something she did.
“My boyfriend’s version of time-out is when he stops talking to me, ignores me, and doesn’t see me or communicate with me,” she explained.
“I earned it last night because I expressed to him I have to be weary about him with women no matter their demographics because he has tried to sleep with multiple women online and at his workplace (old, young, everything).”
Not only did her boyfriend put her in time-out, but he also picked up her coffee machine and threw it, causing it to break.
This all happened when she took a peek at his phone to see if he was paying women for photos, which is something she was worried about him doing behind her back.
She wasn’t angry with her boyfriend; she just expressed her feelings in a calm manner. She also didn’t find anything suspicious in his phone, by the way.
Sign up for Chip Chick’s newsletter and get stories like this delivered to your inbox.

author: justice.gov
title: Western District of Missouri | Anesthesiologist Pleads Guilty to Taking Fentanyl from Hospital | United States Department of Justice
text:
Press Release Anesthesiologist Pleads Guilty to Taking Fentanyl from Hospital Western District of Missouri KANSAS CITY, Mo. – An anesthesiologist at a Lee’s Summit, Mo., hospital pleaded guilty in federal court today to illegally taking fentanyl from the hospital.
Roman Peplinski, 37, of Kansas City, Mo., waived his right to a grand jury and pleaded guilty before U.S. District Judge Greg Kays to a federal information that charges him with one count of obtaining a controlled substance by misrepresentation, fraud, forgery, deception, or subterfuge.
Peplinski was employed as an anesthesiologist at Union Hill Group in Kansas City, Mo. Peplinski worked at Lakewood Medical Center in Lee’s Summit and Truman Medical Center in Kansas City, Mo., which are both part of University Health.
Peplinski admitted that he illegally obtained fentanyl from Lakewood Medical Center on Nov. 5, 2022. Peplinski misrepresented the fentanyl was for a patient, when in reality, that patient had been discharged from Lakewood Medical Center earlier that day. Fentanyl was not listed under the “medication orders” on the patient’s chart for the hospital visit.
Peplinski also admitted to withdrawing fentanyl from three vials from Sept. 1, 2022, through Nov. 30, 2022.
On Feb. 16, 2023, personnel from Lakewood Medical Center reported to the Drug Enforcement Administration that three vials of fentanyl in an automated dispensing cabinet showed signs of tampering. In March 2023 seven vials of fentanyl that were suspected of being tampered with were sent to the FDA’s Forensic Chemistry Center where tests were performed on the vials and their contents. Of the seven vials, three showed evidence of being tampered with. One of those vials contained no fentanyl and the other two vials contained a small amount of fentanyl.
The government has no evidence that any patients were harmed as a result of Peplinski tampering with vials of fentanyl.
Under federal statutes, Peplinski is subject to a sentence of up to four years in federal prison without parole. The maximum statutory sentence is prescribed by Congress and is provided here for informational purposes, as the sentencing of the defendant will be determined by the court based on the advisory sentencing guidelines and other statutory factors. A sentencing hearing will be scheduled after the completion of a presentence investigation by the United States Probation Office.
This case is being prosecuted by Special Assistant U.S. Attorney Bradley Cooper. It was investigated by the Drug Enforcement Administration and Food and Drug Administration-Office of Criminal Investigations.

author: Pablo Rafael Fuentes
title: Sindicato argentino realizará paro y movilización
text:
Foto: Prensa Latina
La Habana, 27 mar (RHC) La Asociación Trabajadores del Estado (ATE) de Argentina continuará hoy su plan de lucha con la realización de un paro nacional y una movilización frente al Ministerio de Desregulación, en Buenos Aires.
En un comunicado, el secretario general de ATE, Rodolfo Aguiar, explicó que las acciones de protesta tienen como objetivo denunciar el riesgo en que se encuentran 50 mil ciudadanos, cuyos vínculos laborales vencen el 31 de este mes.
Tenemos que evitar que el Gobierno ejecute un nuevo recorte en el Estado. Todos los contratos deben ser renovados de manera automática. No toleraremos cesantías masivas, aseveró el dirigente.
Aguiar aseguró que su sindicato participará en un paro general convocado por la Confederación General del Trabajo para el 10 de abril, pero señaló que es necesaria esta otra medida de fuerza antes de esa fecha porque están en riesgo los puestos de esas personas.
Son más de 50 mil vínculos laborales que vencen y ATE exige que cumplan con la renovación automática y anual, según lo establecido en la Resolución 26/24 del Ministerio de Desregulación y Transformación del Estado.
Nos movilizaremos hasta allí porque su titular, Federico Sturzenegger, es quien propone compensar el costo fiscal de los 800 millones de dólares que supone la baja de retenciones al campo y la eliminación de impuestos a los autos de alta gama con un nuevo achique del sector público, el cierre y la fusión de numerosos organismos, indicó.
Además, cuestionó la continuidad de un congelamiento salarial, pidió reabrir de manera inmediata las paritarias (negociaciones) y exigió que sea reparado el daño causado a los ingresos.
Un paro con movilización nos permitirá seguir defendiendo nuestro derecho constitucional a manifestarnos y peticionar libremente a las autoridades, dijo y resaltó la asistencia de los afiliados a ATE a una marcha por el Día de la Memoria por la Verdad y la Justicia. (Fuente: Prensa Latina)
